vocabInfos.lsjDefs:
κληρονομ-ία, ἡ,
inheritance, [Refs 5th c.BC+]; ἡ κ. κατὰ τὴν ἀγχιστείαν inheritance as heir-at-law, [Refs 4th c.BC+] have taken possession of.., [Refs]
__2 property, possession, ἀνέζευξεν ἕκαστος εἰς τὴν κ. αὐτοῦ [LXX]
vocabInfos.shortDef: inheritance, transfer of property and possessions from one generation to another, usually within a family or clan and usually upon the death of the owner. This word often has an implication of a legitimate, historic right to the objects inherited. In some contexts this refers to salvation, an inheritance shared with Jesus Christ, the true heir
vocabInfos.mediumDef:
inheritance, transfer of property and possessions from one generation to another, usually within a family or clan and usually upon the death of the owner. This word often has an implication of a legitimate, historic right to the objects inherited. In some contexts this refers to salvation, an inheritance shared with Jesus Christ, the true heir
an inheritance, patrimony, Mt. 21:38; Mk. 12:7; a possession, portion, property, Acts 7:5; 20:32; in NT a share, participation in privileges, Acts 20:32; Eph. 1:14; 5:5
vocabInfos._es_Definition: propiedad, posesión, posesiones, lo que Dios le promete o le da a su pueblo, bendición o bendiciones de Dios ; herencia, parte (HCH.7:5)
vocabInfos._zh_tw_Definition:
1) 繼承物, 因繼承所得(或將得)的產業
2) 財物, 財產
3) 救恩
4) 繼承人 (羅11:1)
vocabInfos._zh_Definition:
1) 继承物, 因继承所得(或将得)的产业
2) 财物, 财产
3) 救恩
4) 继承人 (罗11:1)
vocabInfos._vi_Definition: sản nghiệp; cơ nghiệp; gia tài
